DPRK Cadres Express Condolences over Death of Russians
articles.content:
DPRK Cadres Express Condolences over Death of Russians
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Jong Ha Chol, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Colonel General of the Korean People's Army Pak Sung Won visited the Russian embassy here Monday expressing condolences over the death of many innocent inhabitants in a hostage-taking incident caused by terrorists in Russia.
 Yang Hyong Sop made an entry in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Diplomats Visit Russian Embassy
articles.content:
Diplomats Visit Russian Embassy
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Diplomats of different countries and representatives of international organizations here visited the Russian embassy Monday to express condolences over the death of many innocent people caused by terrorists' hostage-taking incident in Russia.
 They made entries in the mourner's book.
